title: Ticket #7702: Add per-submitter ceiling to limit cores given to a particular submitt
description: The only way to put an upper bound on how many slots (cores, etc.) a given submitter can get is by creating accounting groups with quotas. LIGO would like a per-submitter limit, including the ability to limit a submitter to 0 cores. Unlike the current fair-share limit, startd RANK would not allow a submitter to go over their limit. We also need to make sure that when the negotiator limits a submitter, an appropriate message is sent to the schedd so that condor_q -analyze knows what's going on.
remarks:
2020-Jul-21 10:13:48 by pfc:
Given our real-world goal (to start all users with a conservative limit, e.g., 100, and then manually "promote" specific users to a higher limit), it might be better if this was unset by default, with a default specified in another config variable, which can be overridden on a per-user basis as we see fit.
